info.description: Provides system related information and functionalities of ctrlX OS.
info.title: ctrlX OS - System API

servers.description: Use this, if this page and the api are on the same server

get.description: Returns the hostname of the device

put.description: Set a new hostname for the device

requestBody.description:
New hostname for device. Must start with character or digit, can contain characters, digits
and hyphon. Maximal allowed length is 64 characters.

Use 'POST /tasks' of type 'TaskReport' instead.

Creates and returns an archive containing files with system information inside like device settings, logbook messages and exception logs.

Conflict.description: The request conflicts with the current state of the resource

Unauthorized.description: Not authorized to access this resource

BadRequest.description: The request is incomplete or malformed

InternalServerError.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

osVersion.description: The version of the operating system

virtualized.description: Shows if the system runs in a virtualized environment

uptime.description: Shows the uptime of the system in seconds

installationId.description: The installation Id of the device

ctrlxOsVersion.description: ctrlX OS version installed on the device. The version is determined by evaluating the major and minor versions of installed system apps (such as Device Admin and Automation Core). If these system apps have different major or minor versions and the overall OS version cannot be determined, this property will display "undefined." To ensure an accurate ctrlX OS version is reported, all system apps must have the same major and minor version.

GenericLinuxTypePlate.description: Generic linux typeplate - derived from the linux smbios type 1, see: https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP0134_3.2.0.pdf

SecondarySerialNumber.description: Secondary serial numbers of components and assemblies contained in the device

enabled.description: resource allocation for memory is enabled state

current.description: Amount of currently allocated memory in kB

min.description: Lower bound for allocation of memory in kB

max.description: Upper bound for allocation of memory in kB

timestamp.description:
The local date and time of the device in the corresponding timezone. Format is based on ISO 8601
without time-offset of timezone: YYYY-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS

timezone.description:
The timezone or location of the device. The timestamp is the time in this given timezone. This can
be a location (e.g. 'Europe/Berlin') from the 'IANA timezone database', a timezone abbrevation (e.g. 'EST') or
'UTC' in case no local timezone shall be configured.
The use of a location is preferred over a timezone abbrevation, because timezone abbrevations can be ambiguous.

unit.description: The physical unit of the sensor value

value.description: The current value of the sensor

id.description: A server generated ID used to identify the task. This ID is unique.

action.description: The action name executed by this task. This has to be inherited and overwritten by the application.

progress.description: Optional progress of the task in percentage.

parameters.description: Optional map of additional parameters required by the request. Should be defined when inherited by an application.

result.description: Optional map reflecting the result of the task. May be empty until task completition. Should be defined when inherited by an application.

Problem.description: This document defines a "problem detail" as a way  to carry machine-readable details of errors in a  HTTP response to avoid the need to define new error  response formats for HTTP APIs.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. 
This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, 
it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type 
(e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). When this member 
is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. 
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, 
except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content 
negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).
If the response is a diagnostics message, it contains 
the text associated with the mainDiagnosisCode.
title.example: You do not have enough credit.

status.description:
The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the 
origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description:
A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
If the response is a diagnostics message, it contains the text associated with
the detailedDiagnosisCode.
detail.example: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description:
A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.
It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

code.description:
An error code issued by the system that caused the original problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause of the error.

mainDiagnosisCode.description:
The main diagnosis code is issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

detailedDiagnosisCode.description:
The detailed diagnosis code issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the detailed cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
The detailed diagnosis code gives additional information about the cause of the error.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

dynamicDescription.description:
A dynamic description gives detailed information about the occurrence of a problem.
It can change between different occurrences of the same error.

severity.description: Severity of a problem as defined RFC5424 of the Syslog standard, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424

links.description:
Collection of links to fix the problem. E.g. links to online user manual,
to an online community (using tags) or a developer chat (e.g. Slack).

moreInfo.description:
The moreInfo field allows you to add additional information that might be necessary to debug or trace down the cause of an error.
It might also contain information what is needed to resolve the problem.
There are loosely specified fields for specific problems that can be used in these situations, e.g.:
- On a 403 Forbidden error: The moreInfo can contain a field "requiredPermissions" with the required permissions seperated by comma
- On a 402 Payment required: The moreInfo can contain a field "requiredLicenses" with the required licenses seperated by comma

cause.description:
Sometimes a problem might be caused by problems that occure in other components or are the root cause of a problem. In this
case the related problems can be added as a cause. Since it might be possible that multiple components have problems on a single
action, cause is an array. E.g. Loading failed because several components where not able to load the configuration.

CpuSettings.description: Describe the cpu settings like number of real time cores

realtime.description:
Describes if core is realtime core. The maximum amount of realtime cores is (total number of cores)-1 (at least one none realtime core).
The minimum value is 0 (no realtime core).

MemoryMeasures.description: The current memory stats of the system including total, free, used, buffer, cache and available.

CpuMeasures.description: The current CPU stats of the system including speed and CPU cores utilization

ctrlXDeviceId.description: CtrlX device id from device certificate

biosVersion.description: The bios version of the device

UbuntuCoreIds.description: Ubuntu Core and Brandstore related properties of the Typeplate

storeBrandId.description: brand id of the device in the store

storeModelId.description: model id of the device in the store

storeSerialId.description: unique id for the device in the store

macAddress.description: The mac address of the interface

severity.description: Severity of the event described by the protocol entry

time.description: Time in RFC 3339 format when the event described by the protocol entry occurred

message.description: Message describing the event that occurred

isolated.description: Isolated core count (isolated by kernel command line or cset for special usage, e. g. real time apps)

online.description: List of online cpu cores. This list may not contain all cores - not all cores has to be online

imageUpdateCapable.description:
The flag indicates if an online image update is possible using the functionality provided by the Device Admin App.
True indicates the system, more specific the gadget, provides all necessary functions to process an image update.
False indicates that the system does not satisfy all prerequisites to execute an online image update.

quotaCapable.description: The flag indicates if the system is capable of handling quotas.

cpusetCapable.description: The flag indicates if the system is capable of handling cpuset.

uefiCapsuleUpdate.description: The flag indicates if the system supports uploading firmware updates in UEFI capsule format.

integrityDegraded.description: System integrity is degraded (e. g. installation of unknown apps is allowed)

fullDiskEncryption.description: Indicates if relevant system partitions are encrypted

total.description: Total memory of system in bytes

swap.description: size of swap partition in bytes

device.description: The device name of the storage device

role.description: The role of the storage device, e. g. system disk

CpuStatistics.description: The utilization and speed of the CPU and cores.

serialNumber.description: The primary serial number of the device

secondarySerialNumbers.description: Secondary serial numbers of components and assemblies contained in the device

materialIndex.description: The revision of the material number

hardwareRevision.description: The hardware revision of the device

ethernets.description: The builtin ethernet interfaces of the device

netXs.description: The netX interfaces of the device

productName.description: The product name of the device

version.description: The version of the device, e.g. ctrlX COREvirtual image

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the device, e.g. used for licensing

sku.description: This text string identifies a particular device configuration for sale.

family.description: This text string identifies the family to which a particular device belongs. A family refers to a set of devices that are similar but not identical from a hardware or software point of view.

rtcOk.description: Indicates whether real time clock is ok or not. If the rtc battery is missing or empty the rtc is not ok.

timeSynchronization.description: Enable or disable time sychronization. If enabled time server is used.

ntpServers.description: Time servers, if time synchronization is enabled.

ntpMinPollInterval.description:
Minimum ntp poll interval in 2^x seconds. Only used if time synchronization is enabled.
The poll interval is used to adjust the requests to the ntp servers according of the accuracy of the responses.

ntpMaxPollInterval.description: Maximum ntp poll interval in 2^x seconds. The maximum value must be greater than ntpMinPollInterval. Only used if time synchronization is enabled.

persistenceInterval.description: Interval in minutes to persist the current time

file.description: Name of the system report file

protocol.description: Protocol collects events that occur while the task is processed

logbookLastHours.description:
Time span in hours. Starting with the most recent message in the logbook,
all messages that occurred within the specified time span are included
 in the system report. 0 means that all messages are included.

logbookLevel.description:
Level of logbook messages. The 'warning' level also contains 'error' messages,
the 'info' level contains 'error' and 'warning' messages, and so on.

createOptions.description: JSON String with 'CreateOptions' inside for setup part. Details see 'Setup API - CreateOptions'.

additionalInfo.description: Additional information text by the user (optional). This could be an error description or any other information that is necessary or helpful for further processing of the report.

path.description: Path where to store the system report file on an external medium connected to the device (optional).
